intro: Anguina cucumerina, commonly known as the cucumber nematode, is a microscopic parasitic worm that primarily infests cucumber plants. This plant parasite belongs to the family Tylenchidae and is a significant pest in agricultural settings. It feeds on the roots of host plants, causing stunted growth and reduced yields. The life cycle of Anguina cucumerina involves several stages, including egg, four juvenile stages, and an adult stage. Its presence can lead to severe damage in commercial cucumber cultivation, necessitating careful management practices.
